sen.j: 芝村藩（しばむらはん）は、大和国式上郡芝村（現在の奈良県桜井市芝）に存在した藩。
sen.e: Shibamura Domain was a feudal clan which existed in Yamato Province Shikijo County Shiba village (present Shiba, Sakurai City, Nara Prefecture).
Shibamura Domain was a feudal domain which was located in Shiba Village, Shikijo County, Yamato Province (present-day Shiba, Sakurai City, Nara Prefecture).
sen.cmt: 他の記事と表現を統一しました。
sen.e: Shibamura Domain was a feudal domain which was located in Shiba Village, Shikijo County, Yamato Province (present-day Shiba, Sakurai City, Nara Prefecture).

sen.j: もとは戒重村（現在の奈良県桜井市戒重）に芝村陣屋を構えていたため、戒重藩（かいじゅうはん）とも呼ばれるが、第7代藩主・織田輔宜の時代に移転した。
sen.e: Originally the Domain held its regional government office in Kaiju Village (present Kaiju, Sakurai City, Nara Prefecture); therefore the Domain is also called Kaiju Domain; howver, the 7th lord of the Domain, Sukeyoshi ODA moved to the Shiba Village.

Since initially the domain held its jinya (regional government office) in Kaiju Village (present Kaiju, Sakurai City, Nara Prefecture), it is also called Kaiju Domain; however, during time of the seventh lord of the domain, Sukeyoshi ODA, it was moved to the Shiba Village.
sen.cmt: 陣屋 を追加しました。Domain を一部小文字にしました。
sen.e: Since initially the domain held its jinya (regional government office) in Kaiju Village (present Kaiju, Sakurai City, Nara Prefecture), it is also called Kaiju Domain; however, during time of the seventh lord of the domain, Sukeyoshi ODA, it was moved to the Shiba Village.

tit.cmt: 他の記事と表現を統一しました。

sen.j: 織田信長の弟で茶人として有名な織田長益は、関ヶ原の戦いでは東軍に与して戦功を挙げたが、その後は豊臣秀頼の大叔父に当たるということから豊臣氏の家臣となっていた。
sen.e: Nagamasu ODA is a younger brother of Nobunaga ODA; he was famous as a master of tea ceremony; at the Battle of Sekigahara, he took part in the eastern army and gave distinguished war service; however, after the war he became the vassal of Toyotomi clan for the reason that he is a granduncle of Hedeyori TOYOTOMI.

Nagamasu ODA, who is a younger brother of Nobunaga ODA and was famous as a master of tea ceremony, contributed to the East camp at the Battle of Sekigahara and gave distinguished war service; however, after the war he became the vassal of Toyotomi clan for the reason that he is a granduncle of Hedeyori TOYOTOMI.
sen.cmt: 翻訳を一部変更しました。
sen.e: Nagamasu ODA, who is a younger brother of Nobunaga ODA and was famous as a master of tea ceremony, contributed to the East camp at the Battle of Sekigahara and gave distinguished war service; however, after the war he became the vassal of Toyotomi clan for the reason that he is a granduncle of Hedeyori TOYOTOMI.

sen.j: ただし、これには徳川氏の間諜として豊臣氏に潜り込んでいたという説もある。
sen.e: But there is an opinion in that Nagamasu ODA crawled into Toyotomi clans as spy for Tokugawa clan.
But there is an opinion that Nagamasu ODA crawled into Toyotomi clan as a spy for Tokugawa clan.
But there is an opinion that Nagamasu ODA crawled into Toyotomi clan as a spy for Tokugawa clan.

sen.j: しかし大坂冬の陣では豊臣氏に与していたため、豊臣氏滅亡後に徳川氏に釈明する意思を表すために、有楽斎は3万石の所領のうち、1万石を自分の隠居料に、残りの1万石ずつをそれぞれ四男の織田長政 (大名)と五男の織田尚長に分与して相続させたのである。
sen.e: However, because he took part in the Toyotomi clan side in Osaka Fuyu no Jin (Winter Siege of Osaka), after Toyotomi clan's fall, Yurakusai (the name Nagamasu ODA has as a master of tea ceremony) tried to express his intention to apologize to Tokugawa clan for this reason out of his territory of thirty thousands goku crop yields, he took Ten thousands goku crop yields for his retirement and allocated ten thousands goku crop yields to the fourth son Naonaga ODA and the allocated the remaining ten thousands goku crop yields to the fifth son, Naonaga ODA.

However, because he took part in the camp of the Toyotomi clan in the Winter Siege of Osaka, Yurakusai (another name of Nagamasu ODA as a master of tea ceremony) tried to express his intention to apologize to Tokugawa clan by dividing his territory of 30,000 koku (an unit of assessed crop yields of the land [1 koku: about 180 liter], which was also used to express the size of the land) into 10,000 koku for his own retirement, 10,000 koku for the fourth son Nagamasa ODA (daimyo [Japanese feudal lord]) and the remaining 10,000 koku for the fifth son, Naonaga ODA after Toyotomi clan's fall.
sen.cmt: 翻訳を一部変更しました。人名を修正しました。
sen.e: However, because he took part in the camp of the Toyotomi clan in the Winter Siege of Osaka, Yurakusai (another name of Nagamasu ODA as a master of tea ceremony) tried to express his intention to apologize to Tokugawa clan by dividing his territory of 30,000 koku (an unit of assessed crop yields of the land [1 koku: about 180 liter], which was also used to express the size of the land) into 10,000 koku for his own retirement, 10,000 koku for the fourth son Nagamasa ODA (daimyo [Japanese feudal lord]) and the remaining 10,000 koku for the fifth son, Naonaga ODA after Toyotomi clan's fall.

sen.j: この四男・長政の系統が芝村藩、五男・尚長の系統が柳本藩としてそれぞれ存続することとなるのである。
sen.e: This fourth son Nagamasa's line is Shibamura Domain and the fifth son Naonaga's line is Yagimoto Domain; both Domains are to exist and continue respectively.
This fourth son Nagamasa's line is Shibamura Domain and the fifth son Naonaga's line is Yanagimoto Domain; both domains are to exist and continue respectively.
sen.cmt: domain 一部小文字にしました。Yanagimoto に修正しました。
sen.e: This fourth son Nagamasa's line is Shibamura Domain and the fifth son Naonaga's line is Yanagimoto Domain; both domains are to exist and continue respectively.

sen.j: 藩政の基礎は初代藩主・長政の頃に固められた。
sen.e: The base of administration of the domain was solidified at the time of the first lord of the domain Nagamasa.
The base of administration of the domain was solidified at the time of the first lord of the domain Nagamasa.
The base of administration of the domain was solidified at the time of the first lord of the domain Nagamasa.

sen.j: 第4代藩主・織田長清の頃には長清自身が優れた文化人であったことも影響して藩校・遷喬館が設立され、藩士に文武が奨励され、さらに長清によって織田氏や信長の記録である織田真記15巻が編纂されるなど、芝村藩は全盛期を迎えた。
sen.e: At the time of Nagakiyo ODA, the fourth lord of the domain, the domain school Senkyokan was established; both of literary arts and military arts were encouraged to the clansmen; furthermore, 15 volumes of Oda Shinki, which was records of Oda clan and Nobunaga was compiled by Nagakiyo; thus, the cultural activities in the domain reached its highest; the lord himself was a man of culture and this fact influenced the vigorous activities went on in the domain in those days.

During the time of Nagakiyo ODA, the fourth lord of the domain, the domain school Senkyokan was established by the influence of Nagakiyo who was a man of culture, and both literary and military arts were encouraged to the clansmen; furthermore, 15 volumes of Oda Shinki, which was records of Oda clan and Nobunaga were compiled by Nagakiyo; thus, the cultural activities in the domain reached its peak.
sen.cmt: 翻訳を一部変更しました。
sen.e: During the time of Nagakiyo ODA, the fourth lord of the domain, the domain school Senkyokan was established by the influence of Nagakiyo who was a man of culture, and both literary and military arts were encouraged to the clansmen; furthermore, 15 volumes of Oda Shinki, which was records of Oda clan and Nobunaga were compiled by Nagakiyo; thus, the cultural activities in the domain reached its peak.

sen.j: 長清は陣屋を戒重から岩田に移そうと願い出て宝永元年（1704年）4月11日に認められたが、しかし長清の治世末期頃から財政悪化が表面化し実現しなかった。
sen.e: Nagakiyo applied for moving his regional governmental office from Kaiju to Iwata and the request was accepted in April 11, 1704; however, towards the end of his administration, financial situation worsened; thus, the moving was not realized.

Nagakiyo had applied for the relocation of the domain's jinya from Kaiju to Iwata, which was accepted in May 14, 1704; however, since the financial situation worsened towards the end of his administration, the moving was not realized.
sen.cmt: 翻訳を一部変更しました。
sen.e: Nagakiyo had applied for the relocation of the domain's jinya from Kaiju to Iwata, which was accepted in May 14, 1704; however, since the financial situation worsened towards the end of his administration, the moving was not realized.

sen.j: 正徳 (日本)3年（1713年）9月27日に岩田村を芝村に改めたのち、実際に陣屋が芝村（桜井市織田・現在の市立織田小学校）に移転したのは、第7代藩主・織田輔宜の代である延享2年（1745年）閏12月12日のことである。
sen.e: In September 27 of 1713 the name of Iwata Village was changed to Shiba Village; however, the time actual moving was executed was the generation of Sukeyoshi ODA, the 7th lord of the domain in intercalary December 12 in 1745 (Oda, Sakurai City, the site is currently Municipal Oda Elementary School).

On November 14, 1713, the name of Iwata Village was changed to Shiba Village; it was on February 2 in 1746, during the generation of Sukeyoshi ODA, the seventh lord of the domain, that the jinya was actually relocated to Shiba Village (Oda, Sakurai City, the site is currently Municipal Oda Elementary School).
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に変更しました。
sen.e: On November 14, 1713, the name of Iwata Village was changed to Shiba Village; it was on February 2 in 1746, during the generation of Sukeyoshi ODA, the seventh lord of the domain, that the jinya was actually relocated to Shiba Village (Oda, Sakurai City, the site is currently Municipal Oda Elementary School).

sen.j: ちなみに長清以来の歴代藩主が陣屋の移転にこだわったのは、戒重が年貢収納に不便な土地だったのに対し、芝村（岩田村）が藩領の中心地で何かと便利だったためである。
sen.e: The reason why successive lords of the Domain since Nagakiyo were particular about a move of the regional government office is that Shibamura (Iwata-mura) was located in the center of the territory and convenient for doing anything; whereas Kaiju is an inconvenient place to collect land tax.

The reason why successive lords of the domain since Nagakiyo were particular about a move of the jinya is that Shiba Village (Iwata Village) was located in the center of the territory and convenient for doing anything; whereas Kaiju is an inconvenient place to collect land tax.
sen.cmt: domain 一部小文字にしました。
sen.e: The reason why successive lords of the domain since Nagakiyo were particular about a move of the jinya is that Shiba Village (Iwata Village) was located in the center of the territory and convenient for doing anything; whereas Kaiju is an inconvenient place to collect land tax.

sen.j: ちなみに第7代藩主・輔宜の頃から幕命によって天領の預かりを任されるようになった。
sen.e: From the time of Sukeyoshi, the 7th lord of the Domain, Shibamura Domain was to manage Shogunate demesne by the order made by the Edo Shogunate.

From the time of Sukeyoshi, the seventh lord of the domain, Shibamura Domain was responsible for the management of the Shogunate demesne by the order made by the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).
sen.cmt: 数字をスペルアウトしました。幕府 追加しました。
sen.e: From the time of Sukeyoshi, the seventh lord of the domain, Shibamura Domain was responsible for the management of the Shogunate demesne by the order made by the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).

sen.j: 延享3年（1746年）には預かり地が9万石近くに達し、第8代藩主・織田長教の代になると9万3430石を任されるようになった。
sen.e: In 1746 the land of custody reached nearly 90,000 koku; in the time of the 8th lord, Naganori ODA, he was asked to manage the land of 93,430 koku.
In 1746 the land of custody reached nearly 90,000 koku; in the time of the eighth lord, Naganori ODA, he was asked to manage the land of 93,430 koku.
sen.cmt: 数字をスペルアウトしました。
sen.e: In 1746 the land of custody reached nearly 90,000 koku; in the time of the eighth lord, Naganori ODA, he was asked to manage the land of 93,430 koku.

sen.j: つまり、大半は預かり地であるが芝村藩領は10万石以上になったのである。
sen.e: In other words most of the land was the land in custody; however, the territory of Shibamura Domain became more than 100,000 koku.
In other words most of the land was the land in custody; however, the territory of Shibamura Domain became more than 100,000 koku.
In other words most of the land was the land in custody; however, the territory of Shibamura Domain became more than 100,000 koku.

sen.j: さらに預かり地の統治を任されていた杉浦弥左衛門や吉田千左衛門らの預かり地における統治もある程度成功を収めたため、幕府から厚く賞賛されるに至った。
sen.e: Yazaemon SUGIURA and Senzaemon YOSHIDA were entrusted to manage the land in custody; as their way of management showed success to some extent, Shibamura Domain was praised by the Shogunate generously.
Yazaemon SUGIURA and Senzaemon YOSHIDA were entrusted to manage the land in custody; as their way of management showed success to some extent, Shibamura Domain was praised by the bakufu generously.
sen.cmt: 幕府 追加しました。
sen.e: Yazaemon SUGIURA and Senzaemon YOSHIDA were entrusted to manage the land in custody; as their way of management showed success to some extent, Shibamura Domain was praised by the bakufu generously.

sen.j: しかし宝暦3年（1753年）末、杉浦や吉田らが行なった年貢増徴政策に対して預かり地における百姓一揆が頻発して発生し、遂には百姓たちが芝村藩を批判して預かり地の所替えを要求するに至った。
sen.e: However, in 1753 SIGIURA, YOSHIDA and others imposed slight increase on the land tax; the farmers did not like this increase; hereafter in the land in custody frequently peasant's revolt occurred and finally farmers came to criticize Shibamura Domain and came to ask Shogunate to change the Domain who will be in charge of the land in custody.

However, in 1753, the tax increase measure imposed by SUGIURA, YOSHIDA and others triggered frequent peasant's revolts, eventually leading farmers to criticize Shibamura Domain and demanding the relocation of the land in custody.
sen.cmt: 翻訳を一部変更しました。
sen.e: However, in 1753, the tax increase measure imposed by SUGIURA, YOSHIDA and others triggered frequent peasant's revolts, eventually leading farmers to criticize Shibamura Domain and demanding the relocation of the land in custody.

sen.j: これを芝村騒動という。
sen.e: This is called Shibamura Village Riot.
This is called Shibamura Village Riot.
This is called Shibamura Village Riot.

sen.j: 幕府はこの騒動を鎮圧したが、寛政6年（1794年）に預かり地における芝村藩の役人による不正が発覚し、幕命により藩主・長教をはじめとする要人が処罰され、預かり地も全て召し上げられるに至った。
sen.e: The Shogunate suppressed these disturbances, but injustice by the government official of Shibamura Domain in the land in custody was found out in 1794; as a result, very important people including the lord of the Domain, Naganori are punished by the command of the Shogunate; all the lands in custody are taken away also.

The bakufu suppressed these disturbances, however, since injustice by the government officials of Shibamura Domain in the land in custody was exposed in 1794, key figures including the lord of the domain, Naganori are punished by the command of the bakufu, and all the lands in custody are taken away also.
sen.cmt: 翻訳を一部変更しました。
sen.e: The bakufu suppressed these disturbances, however, since injustice by the government officials of Shibamura Domain in the land in custody was exposed in 1794, key figures including the lord of the domain, Naganori are punished by the command of the bakufu, and all the lands in custody are taken away also.

sen.j: 藩内においても長教の時代から藩財政の窮乏化が深刻化し、明和5年（1768年）末には年貢減免を求める強訴が発生する。
sen.e: Within the Shibamura Domain, from the time of Naganori impoverishment of the Domain's financial state worsened; in 1768 direct petition seeking land tax reduction or exemption occurred.
From the time of Naganori, the impoverishment of the financial state aggravated within the Shibamura Domain, and in the end of 1768 a petition seeking land tax reduction or exemption occurred.
sen.cmt: 翻訳を一部変更しました。
sen.e: From the time of Naganori, the impoverishment of the financial state aggravated within the Shibamura Domain, and in the end of 1768 a petition seeking land tax reduction or exemption occurred.

sen.j: これに対して藩では藩札の発行や家臣の知行借り上げ、御用金の調達などによる藩政改革が試みられたが、あまり効果は無く、安政6年（1859年）には藩の借金は銀2693貫という莫大なものになったと言われている。
sen.e: In an effort to reform the financial difficulty, Shibamura Domain carried out some measures; these included issuing of paper money to be used only within the domain, borrowing of fief of vassals, raising money by collecting money from farmers and merchants; however no particular effect was gained; it is said that in 1859 the debt of Shibamura Domain reached 2693 kan of silver.

In an effort to reform the financial difficulty, Shibamura Domain carried out some measures including issuing paper money to be used only within the domain, borrowing fief of vassals, raising money by collecting money from farmers and merchants; however no particular effect was gained, and it is said that in 1859 the debt of Shibamura Domain reached 2693 kan of silver.
sen.cmt: 翻訳を一部変更しました。
sen.e: In an effort to reform the financial difficulty, Shibamura Domain carried out some measures including issuing paper money to be used only within the domain, borrowing fief of vassals, raising money by collecting money from farmers and merchants; however no particular effect was gained, and it is said that in 1859 the debt of Shibamura Domain reached 2693 kan of silver.

sen.j: 幕末期、最後の藩主である織田長易は天誅組追捕の功績を挙げている。
sen.e: Nagayasu ODA who became the last lord of the Shibamura Domain at the end of the Edo period, contributed for search and capture of Tenchu-gumi.
Nagayasu ODA who became the last lord of the Shibamura Domain at the end of the Edo period, contributed for search and capture of Tenchu-gumi.
Nagayasu ODA who became the last lord of the Shibamura Domain at the end of the Edo period, contributed for search and capture of Tenchu-gumi.

sen.j: しかし明治維新頃から幕府より離れて新政府側に与し、維新後は高取藩と共に大和国内における御料の取締りを命じられた。
sen.e: However, from around Meiji Restoration the Shibamura Domain distanced itself from the Shogunate and become cooperative with the new government; From the new government asked to control the property of the government together with Takatori Domain.

However, from around Meiji Restoration the Shibamura Domain distanced itself from the bakufu and became cooperative with the new government; after the Restoration it was asked by the new government to control the property of the government within Yamato Province together with Takatori Domain.

However, from around Meiji Restoration the Shibamura Domain distanced itself from the bakufu and became cooperative with the new government; after the Restoration it was asked by the new government to control the property of the government within Yamato Province together with Takatori Domain.

sen.j: 明治2年（1869年）の版籍奉還で長易は藩知事となり、同4年（1871年）の廃藩置県で芝村藩は廃藩となった。
sen.e: In 1869 with abolition of feudal domains and establishment of prefectures, Nagaeki became the governor of Shibamura Domain; in 1871 Shibamura Domain was abolished.
In 1869 with abolition of feudal domains and establishment of prefectures, Nagayasu became the governor of Shibamura Domain; in 1871 Shibamura Domain was abolished.
In 1869 with abolition of feudal domains and establishment of prefectures, Nagayasu became the governor of Shibamura Domain; in 1871 Shibamura Domain was abolished.

sen.j: 藩領のうち、摂津国嶋下郡における領地は大阪府、大和山辺郡と式上郡は奈良県にそれぞれ編入された。
sen.e: Among the land of domains the territory in Shimashiro Country, Settsu Province is incorporated Osaka; Yamato Yamabe County and the Shikijo Country were incorporated to Nara Prefecture respectively.
Among the domain territory Shimashiro Country, Settsu Province is incorporated into Osaka Prefecture; Yamato Yamabe County and the Shikijo Country were incorporated into Nara Prefecture respectively.
sen.cmt: 翻訳を一部変更しました。
sen.e: Among the domain territory Shimashiro Country, Settsu Province is incorporated into Osaka Prefecture; Yamato Yamabe County and the Shikijo Country were incorporated into Nara Prefecture respectively.

sen.j: 代々の墓所は桜井市内にある慶田寺であり、有楽斎の分骨の墓標もある。
sen.e: Graveyard for generations is Keiden-ji Temple which is in Sakurai City; there is a gravepost of bone of Yurakusai.
Graveyard for successive lords is located in Keiden-ji Temple which is in Sakurai City; there is also a gravepost for the separated ashes for Yurakusai.
sen.cmt: 翻訳を一部変更しました。
sen.e: Graveyard for successive lords is located in Keiden-ji Temple which is in Sakurai City; there is also a gravepost for the separated ashes for Yurakusai.

sen.j: なお、織田氏の諸藩では、織田信雄の系統で天童藩、丹波柏原藩が、有楽斎の系統では芝村藩の他に柳本藩が、明治維新まで存続した。
sen.e: Among the various Domains of Oda clan, Tendo Domain and Kaibara Domain whichi are in line of Nobukatsu Oda; and besides Shibamura Domain, YagimotoDomain whichi is in lin of Yurakusai, existed up to Meiji Resolution.

Among the various domains of Oda clan, Tendo Domain and Kaibara Domain which are in line of Nobukatsu ODA and Yanagimoto Domain which is in line of Yurakusai besides Shibamura Domain, existed up to Meiji Restoration.
sen.cmt: Meiji Restoration に修正しました。
sen.e: Among the various domains of Oda clan, Tendo Domain and Kaibara Domain which are in line of Nobukatsu ODA and Yanagimoto Domain which is in line of Yurakusai besides Shibamura Domain, existed up to Meiji Restoration.

sen.j: 有楽斎の系統は他に味舌藩、野村藩が存在したが、これらは江戸時代初期に除封、無嗣断絶している。
sen.e: In line of Yurakusai, there is Mashita Domain and Nomura Domain; however, they were abridged their territory at the early Edo period and with no successor they no longer exist.
Mashita Domain and Nomura Domain had also existed as a line of Yurakusai, however, they were abolished due to having no successor in the early Edo period.
sen.cmt: 翻訳を一部変更しました。
sen.e: Mashita Domain and Nomura Domain had also existed as a line of Yurakusai, however, they were abolished due to having no successor in the early Edo period.
